msContents.summary: Receipts addressed to the state bank of Sabinos and Company by guards and transport men, which were pasted together into a continuous roll. They record 3 types of service: land transport of public grain; water transport; wages paid to policemen and tower-guards

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; on the back P.Col. V 1 verso 4
The receipts are written by many different hands; the hand of col. 2 seems to be the same as that of Herakleides, the secretary of the tower guards: a sprawling and difficult handwriting
The receipts are in chronological order, with one exception
All the 19 receipts follow a common form; they are in memorandum form
In most of the receipts it is said that the payment was authorized by the royal scribe Ptolemaios who represented the strategos
There is only 1 skipper receipt which shows an increase in legal requirements of documentation

The guards received different payments for no apparent reason; their ages were between 20 and 45, with the exception of one 57 years old; they were all illiterate and a private notary Herakleides, signed for them

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,7 and 1,10 (Lot II) in Bell

keywords.term: Ptolemaios, -- royal scribe of the Polemon meris
